item.title: The Strange Story of Martin Colby
item.dc:creator: Ward Sterling

image.title: The Strange Story of Martin Colby

item.description: This is Martin Colby’s story, not mine. Three of us heard him tell it — Willoughby, the eminent English clergyman, who is now filling a number of lecture engagements in this country, Mosby, the attorney, and myself—and we are all firmly convinced that he spoke the truth. I write it just as he gave it to us.

item.title: Ananias Ltd.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Dudley
item.description: There are thousands of tons of gold locked up in God's eternal mountains which men will never see nor spend. But that fact doesn't keep them from trying. There is something about yellow metal which turns heads, transforms morals and grows devils in the soil of saints.

item.title: The Poison
item.dc:creator: Tom Curry
item.description: Detective Sullivan thought he had an air-tight murder charge against Francis Small. Clearly, he had poisoned his wealthy aunt in order to get her money, and Sullivan was confident his evidence would convict the ambitious young man … And then something happened, something quite unexpected, that completely upset Sullivan’s case … By a pretty piece of detective work he trapped the real murderer — and provided Tom Curry with a good story plot.

item.title: Easy Money
item.dc:creator: Lee Floren
item.description: A fight manager can’t be fooled by one of his oldtime boys even in disguise!

item.title: Easy Money men
item.dc:creator: Eric Howard
item.description: A panoramic view of New York's underworld, of studio life in Hollywood, of con men and dicks, of counterfeiters and government agents, of thieves and dips and jail birds, and a former chief of police who promotes a private detective bureau for the purpose of snaring all law-breakers, large and small.

item.title: A Snitch in Time
item.dc:creator: E. C. Marshall
item.description: Locked in a windowless room, in a secret building, this kidnaped magnate still found a dead sure way to trap his unknown captor.

item.title: Daughter of the Pigeon
item.dc:creator: Harry C. Hervey, Jr.
item.description: “The cave!” I shouted, pressing the knife into her hand and pointing to the nearby cavity.

item.title: The Explosive Gentleman
item.dc:creator: J. J. Stagg
item.description: Just how much nonsense do you expect nitroglycerine to stand for? It had been scratched, scraped, tossed about carelessly and stepped on. Now the hot end of a cigar was being applied to it. Can yon blame it for raising a splutter?
